Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of PRRA and H&C decisions
Crimes.Procedural_Context: Post-refusal review via PRRA and H&C applications
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Applicants found lacking credibility due to equivocal evidence and prior inconsistencies
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Allegations of rape and trafficking without objective documentation
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of domestic violence and persecution by mother's former spouse
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Lack of credible, objective evidence supporting risk or hardship
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA Section 113(a) – limitations on new evidence in PRRA
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to substantiate claims with verifiable evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: None explicitly ignored; insufficient evidence provided
Crimes.Legal_Standard: Reasonableness standard applied to administrative decisions
Crimes.Application_Factor: Prior use of false passports affecting credibility
Crimes.Authority: Immigration and Refugee Board / Immigration Officer
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether officer’s assessment met the reasonableness threshold
Crimes.Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA sections related to PRRA and H&C grounds
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Inadmissibility due to false documents and lack of credible protection claims
Crimes.Legal_Provision_Cited: IRPA s. 25 (H&C), s. 113(a) (new evidence in PRRA)
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Subjective allegations unsupported by corroborating evidence
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: History of misrepresentation affecting overall credibility
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Claimed humanitarian and compassionate grounds based on family circumstances
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canadian immigration law and refugee protection system
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Timing and admissibility of evidence in PRRA process
Crimes.Omission_Type: Failure to disclose or verify identity at entry

Crimes.Crime_Name: Using forged documents to gain entry
Crimes.Legal_Issue: Reasonableness of refusal of PRRA and H&C applications
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Claims deemed not credible due to lack of supporting evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Alleged domestic violence and fear of persecution, unsubstantiated
Crimes.Basis_of_Claim: Fear of harm from mother's former spouse in Nigeria
Crimes.Key_Factor_in_Determination: Absence of objective evidence to establish risk or hardship
Crimes.Proceeding_Type: Judicial Review of PRRA and H&C denials
Crimes.Regulation_Cited: IRPA s. 113(a) – restriction on new evidence in PRRA
Crimes.Application_Error: Failure to provide timely and credible evidence
Crimes.Evidence_Ignored: No indication that relevant evidence was ignored
Crimes.Decision_Review_Issue: Whether the officer properly assessed risk and hardship claims
Crimes.Cause_of_Refusal: Insufficient proof of risk or hardship; document fraud
Crimes.Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of corroboration for serious allegations
Crimes.Document_Fraud: Use of forged passports to enter Canada
Crimes.Credibility_Issues: Doubts about truthfulness due to fabricated entry documents
Crimes.Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Humanitarian and Compassionate grounds based on family vulnerability
Crimes.Jurisdictional_Focus: Canada’s immigration and refugee determination system
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Admissibility of evidence after initial claim rejection
Crimes.Omission_Type: Non-disclosure of true identity and travel documents
Crimes.Grounds_for_Inadmissibility: Misrepresentation and use of forged documents
